verses.verse: Jesus traveled to the Mountain of the Olives.
At daybreak again, He showed up on the temple grounds, and the entire group was coming to Him. And after He was seated, He was teaching them.
The Old Testament transcribers and the Separatists lead a woman to Him who has been taken down while cheating on her spouse. And after they stand her in the middle,
they say to Him, "Teacher, this woman was taken down over the very act, cheating on her spouse.
In the law, Moses demanded us to be having stones thrown at these types of women. So what do You say?"

They were saying this, trying to cause trouble with Him, so that they may have a complaint to be leveling against Him. But after Jesus stooped down, He was writing in the soil with His finger pretending to not hear them.
As they were staying at it, asking Him, when He stood upright, He said to them, "Your first sinless person must throw the stone on her."
And again after stooping down, He was writing in the soil.

The people who heard it and were reprimanded by their conscience were going out one by one, beginning from the older men until the last. And Jesus was left down there alone and the woman who had stood in the middle.
When Jesus stood upright and saw no one other than the woman, He said to her, "The woman — where are those complainants agaist you? Did no one find you guilty?"
The woman said, "No one, Master." Jesus said to her, "Neither do I find you guilty. Travel home, and do not sin anymore."
So again Jesus spoke to them, saying, "I am the Light of the world. The person following Me will not in any way traipse around in the dark, but will have the light of the life."
So the Separatists said to Him, "You are telling what You witness about Yourself. Your witness account is not truthful."

Jesus answered and said to them, "Even if I should tell what I witness about Myself, My witness account is truthful because I realize where I came from and where I am going back to. But you do not realize where I come from and where I am going back to.
You judge in line with the physical body. I do not judge anyone.
Even if I judge, the judgment, My judgment, is truthful because I am not alone, but it is I and the Father who sent Me,
and in the law, your law, it has been written, (in Deuteronomy 17:6 and 19:15) 'The witness account of two people is truthful.'
I am the One who tells what I witness about Myself, and He tells what He witnesses about Me, the Father who sent Me."
So they were saying to Him, "Where is Your Father?" Jesus answered, "You know neither Me, nor My Father. If you knew Me, you would also know My Father."
Jesus spoke these statements at the treasury vault as He taught on the temple grounds. And no one arrested Him because His hour had not come yet.
So Jesus said to them again, "I am going back, and you will look for Me and die in your sin. Where I am going back to, you are not able to go to."
So the Jewish people were saying, "He won't kill Himself, will He? Because He says, 'Where I am going back to, you are not able to go to'?"
He also said to them, "You are from the ones below. I am from the ones above. You are from this world. I am not from this world.
So I said to you, 'You will die in your sins.' You see, if you do not trust that 'I am', you will die in your sins."
So they were saying to Him, "You, who are you?" Jesus said to them, "Primarily, something that I am also speaking to you.
I have many things to be speaking and to be judging about you, but the One who sent Me is truthful, and I say these things to the world that I heard from the side of Him."
They did not know that He was telling them of the Father.
So Jesus said to them, "When you put the Son of the Person up high, at that time, you will know that 'I am', and I do nothing on My own, but just as My Father taught Me, I am speaking these things.
And the One who sent Me is with Me. The Father did not leave Me alone because I always do the things satisfying to Him."
As He was speaking these things, many trusted in Him.
So Jesus was saying to the Jewish people who had trusted Him, "If you stay in the message, My message, you truly are My students.
And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free."
They responded to Him, "We are Abraham's seed and have not been slaves at any time to anyone. How are you saying, 'You will become free?'"
Jesus answered them, "Amen, amen, I tell you that everyone committing the sin is a slave of the sin.
The slave does not stay in the house for the span of time. The Son stays for the span of time.
So if the Son set you free, you will really be free.
I realize that you are Abraham's seed, but you are looking to kill Me because there is no room in you for the message, My message.
I am speaking what I have seen beside My Father, so you also are doing what you have seen beside your father."
They responded and said to Him, "Our father is Abraham." Jesus says to them, "If you were Abraham's children, you would do the actions of Abraham.
But now you are looking to kill Me (a person who — I have spoken the truth to you that I heard from the side of God). This, Abraham did not do.
You are doing the actions of your father." So they said to Him, "We haven't been born from sexual sin. We have one Father, God."
Jesus said to them, "If God were your Father, you would be loving Me. You see, I came out from God, and I have arrived; for neither have I come on My own, but that One sent me out on a mission.
Why don't you know the speech, My speech? Because you are not able to be hearing the message, My message.

You are from a father, the Accuser, and you want to be doing the desires of your father. That Accuser was a people-killer from the beginning and has not stood in the truth because truth is not in him. Whenever he speaks the lie, he speaks on his own because he is a liar and its father.
But because I tell the truth, you do not trust Me.
Who from among you reprimands Me about a sin? If I tell the truth, why don't you trust Me?
The person who is from God hears the statements of God. Because of this, you don't hear, because you are not from God."
So the Jewish people responded and said to Him, "Don't we nicely say that you are a Samaritan and have a demon?"
Jesus responded, "I do not have a demon, but I value My Father, and you belittle Me.
I am not looking for My magnificence. He is the One looking for it and judging.
Amen, amen, I tell you, if anyone keeps the message, My message, he will not in any way see death for the span of time."

So the Jewish people said to Him, "Now we have known that you have a demon. Abraham and the preachers died, and You are saying, 'If anyone keeps My message, he will not in any way taste death for the span of time.'
You are not greater than our father Abraham, someone who is dead, are You? And the preachers died. Who are You making Yourself out to be?"
Jesus answered, "If I make Myself magnificent, My magnificence is nothing. My Father is the One who makes Me magnificent, whom you say that He is your God,
and you have not known Him, but I have seen Him. If I even say that I have not seen Him, I will be like you, a liar, but I have seen Him, and I keep His message.
Your father Abraham was excited that he might see the day, My day. And he saw it and was happy."
So the Jewish people said to Him, "You don't yet have fifty years, and You have seen Abraham?"
Jesus said to them, "Amen, amen, I tell you, before the time for Abraham to come into existence, I am."
So they picked up stones so that they might throw them on Him, but Jesus hid and went out of the temple grounds, going through the middle of them and in this way was passing on by.
